dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 235 IH: Permanent Internet Tax Freedom Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Goodlatte (for himself, Ms. Eshoo, Mr. Chabot, Mr. Cohen, and Mr. Marino) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To permanently extend the Internet Tax Freedom Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Permanent Internet Tax Freedom Act.

section.header: Permanent moratorium on Internet access taxes and multiple and discriminatory taxes on electronic commerce

subsection.text: Section 1101(a) of the Internet Tax Freedom Act (47 U.S.C. 151 note) is amended by striking during the period beginning November 1, 2003, and ending October 1, 2015.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxes imposed after the date of the enactment of this Act.
